metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9791 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The type inference system allows the compilation of functions that cancause type confusions between arbitrary objects when compiled through theIonMonkey just-in-time (JIT) compiler and when the constructor function isentered through on-stack replacement (OSR). This allows for possiblearbitrary reading and writing of objects during an exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6, and Firefox <66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
